context_of_use: This use case supports customers in managing their shopping experience and allows managers to oversee order approvals.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to purchase items easily
manager: wants to ensure timely order approvals
description: This use case enables customers to add products to their cart, checkout, and track their orders, while allowing managers to approve those orders.
preconditions: Customer has selected products to purchase.
Customer is logged into their account.
postconditions: Customer's order is successfully placed and tracked.
assumptions: Customers have access to the product catalog.
Managers have the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall enable customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall permit managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the payment methods supported during checkout.
main_flow: 1. Customer adds products to cart → System updates cart with selected products.
2. Customer initiates checkout → System presents payment options.
3. Customer selects payment method → System processes payment.
4. System confirms order placement → Customer receives order confirmation.
5. Customer tracks order status → System provides current delivery status.
6. Manager reviews order → System displays order details for approval.
7. Manager approves order → System updates order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): Customer decides to browse products → System redirects to product catalog.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): Payment processing fails → System notifies customer of payment failure.
